definition: no cause, no reason (idiom); completely uncalled for
variant of 平白無故|平白无故[ping2 bai2 wu2 gu4]
to have no basis in fact (idiom)

sentences.english: The world famous brand electrical control components to ensure long-term trouble-free operation of the machine.
sentences.chinese: 世界名牌电器控制元器件，确保机器长期无故障运行。

sentences.english: A man complained about a "constant inexplicable cough".
sentences.chinese: 一个男士抱怨他的持续无故咳嗽。
这是一个安全无故障的设备。

sentences.english: John didn't have a good excuse for his absence so he made up one.
sentences.chinese: 约翰无故缺席，因此他编了一个理由。

sentences.english: The cake maker shakes a naked snake with the qusimilarg rake without sake.
sentences.chinese: 蛋糕制造者无缘无故地用寒战的耙子摆一条赤裸的蛇。

sentences.english: He has sued on the ground of being dismissed without any reason.
sentences.chinese: 他已经以无故被革职为由提出了诉讼。

sentences.english: This can cause tests to fail gratuitously.
sentences.chinese: 这会导致测试无缘无故地失败。

sentences.english: I get twitches and shakes out of nowhere, I always lose my line of thought.
sentences.chinese: 我会平白无故地抽搐，总是忘记自己想说什么。

sentences.english: The cake dor shakes a naked snake dawn the quaking rake lacking sake.
sentences.chinese: 蛋糕制造者无缘无故地用抖动的耙子摇一条赤的蛇。

sentences.english: The cake maker all-overs a naked snake with the agitation rake without account.
sentences.chinese: 蛋糕制造者平白无故地用抖动的耙子摇一条赤裸的蛇。

sentences.english: Students who do not take the test without proper reasons get zero point for this exam.
sentences.chinese: 无故不参加各项考试者，以零分计算。

sentences.english: She sometimes angers with little or no provocation.
sentences.chinese: 她有时无缘无故就生气。

sentences.english: Like a fluttering sparrow or a darting swallow, an undeserved curse does not come to rest.
sentences.chinese: 麻雀往来，燕子翻飞，这样，无故的咒诅也必不临到。

sentences.english: My report of resignation was fall into abeyance without sake.
sentences.chinese: 我的辞职报告无缘无故被搁置了。

sentences.english: All the complex power generation equipment remains easily accessible onshore.
sentences.chinese: 所有复杂的电力设备都会在水上轻松且无故障地运作。

definition: no cause, no reason (idiom); completely uncalled for
to pay no heed to (idiom)/to ignore/to brush aside
to cause trouble/to provoke a dispute
to beat up/to come to blows/battery (law)
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
variant of 平白無故|平白无故[ping2 bai2 wu2 gu4]

pinyin: yi1 er2 zai4 , zai4 er2 san1
